resources.string: Swipe to the side to remove this message
Permission rejected; You can manage permissions in the system settings
The premium version is not available in the local mode. You can buy a stay awesome license.
You did not buy the premium version or the premium version expired.
You have got the premium version until %s.
The server you are using does not limit the access to the features of the premium version.
Tap here to buy or extend the premium version.
Tap here to buy a stay awesome license.

curve25519-java (GNU General Public License v3.0) 
ZXing (Apache License 2.0)
Tap here to access details which help diagnosing errors
Enter the code at the device which you would like to add.
This allows to add used time/ mark time as used in case it was used outside of TimeLimit, e.g. when you want to add telescreen usage to the used time
If you chose a password for the child, then it can switch to its own user with its password. This feature is disabled if a child does not have a password.
There was a manipulation of TimeLimit. Due to that, this device is locked for a moment.
The device will be unlocked in %s.
The settings will be locked again when you leave TimeLimit
To continue, you need an e-mail address to which you have got access
Sign in with a mail address
TimeLimit will send you a message with a code which you enter here to authenticate.
If you signed in earlier using your Google account, then just use the mail address which is assigned to your Google account.
Sorry, but we can not send messages to users of this mail provider. Please use a different mail address.
There is a server side whitelist of mail addresses and the specified mail address is not in this whitelist
There were much login attempts. Due to that, signing in is temporarily blocked. This blocking is disabled automatically.
Uninstall TimeLimit without password using the support
Send the following nonce (with the reason for the unlocking) to the support to get a unlock code:
Tap here or turn screen off to undo
TimeLimit still runs to do that
TimeLimit: Failure while trying to update the app list
You can set blocked time areas here. During a blocked time area, no Apps of the category can be used. You can define the time area to the minute.
There are 2 colors in this view: green means allowed, red means blocked.
The days and hour are displayed as headlines, the minutes as tiles. You can jump to a day using the day dropdown.
To change one area, tap on the start time. It will become blue. Then select the end time. Now, the area colors will be inverted.
The blocked time areas were changed
You can only add limits without parent; Undoing is not possible
Copy settings from one day to other days
Show Apps assigned to other categories
Show Apps from devices not assigned to this child
You can only add Activities if you did not select any Apps for assigning.
There are no Activities which match this search term
There are no Activities which can be assigned now
There are no known activities. Please check if there is a device with this App where blocking at activity level was enabled.
TimeLimit did not (yet) record any Apps
There are no matching Apps for the current list filter
There are no Apps which can be assigned without parent
There is no device to which this user was assigned and thus there are no Apps at devices to which this user was assigned
There is a device assigned to this user, but there are no know Apps. Did the device receive the user assignment?
There is no device with any child assigned. Due to that, no Apps were recorded and thus no assignable Apps are known.
There is a device which was assigned to a child but there are no known Apps. Did the device receive the user assignment?

When enabling the notification access in the device entries, then notifications are blocked at blocked time areas and when the time is over. Here you can enable blocking all notifications from Apps of a category. This feature requires that the notification access was enabled. Otherwise, it does not work.
Enabling this blocks ALL notifications from Apps of this category, when the Apps itself are blocked AND when the Apps itself are not blocked
The new name must not be empty
The extra time allows (if not limited by rules) to use the category longer than usually. It is used if the regular time was used up and does not expire otherwise.
The new extra time was saved
Do you want to delete the category %s?

When the parent category of a category is blocked (e.g. because the time is over), then the child category is blocked too. When using the child category, the used time is also added to the parent category.
This category is a child category of %s now.
This allows to set minimum battery levels for this category
While charging, the battery must have at least %d\%%
While discharging, the battery must have at least %d\%%

Here you can configure time limit rules. Every rule describes one limit. Rules at which multiple days are checked limit the total usage duration during a week at all selected days. Rules at which only one day is checked only limit the selected day.
is applied to extra time, too
The start time must be before the end time
This rule will limit the total usage duration during one week at the selected days. If you want it per day, create one rule per day.
This rule will limit the usage duration only in the specified interval. Without rules for other times or blocked time areas, there will be no limit outside of this interval.
If there is less time remaining than checked, then a notification will be shown
Allow this user to add limits for itself

This is mainly useful for the self limitation. It allows the user to add some limits without signing in as parent: 
- adding time limit rules 
- extending blocked time areas 
- adding used time 
- creating categories 
- enabling the notification filter for a category 
- setting a parent category as long as the category is moved downwards in the category hierarchy 
- adding Apps to categories if they are moved to a child category of their current category or if they are not part of any category and the target category is a child category of the category for not assigned Apps 
- block categories temporarily/ extend temporarily blocking of categories 
- disable the temporarily disabling of the limitations for a category
Some options are unavailable because no parent user is signed in

This is a list of phone numbers. Parents can add items from the contact list of the device. Every user of this device can start a call to one of these numbers using this screen. This works if the phone app is blocked. The phone numbers are only saved at this device and are never transmitted.
You must sign in to remove contacts
Call started; You can hang up using the notification area

Never use a custom server if you don\'t know its operator or if you don\'t trust its operator. The operator of the server can see and edit your configuration remotely if you use the connected mode. Starting Android 9, you must use a https url.
It seems like this Server is not a TimeLimit server
You are using the default server
You are using the custom server %s
Are you sure that you want to delete the child user %s?
TimeLimit can sync when it is not in use. This allows it to show notifications about updates or manipulations.
This is only available in the connected mode
You can change this setting only at the device itself
TimeLimit was uninstalled from this device
You can remove this device to remove it from your device list
There is nothing which needs to be synchronized
Force network time at system level
Keep connected when the screen is off
Try to detect multiple active Apps (splitscreen support)
Only allow login of parent users with limit login category after syncing
Automatically disable splitscreen using the accessibility service
Hide manipulation warning in the category list
Do not use a overlay or the home button for blocking
Password prompts are enabled at the device. You can disable it when logging in at the device.
Password prompts are disabled at the device.
Something went wrong during the transmission
TimeLimit itself is no complete homescreen, so you can chose what should be shown
You can open this menu at any time by repeating tapping the home button
Here you can configure the delay for the redirection in seconds
Starting with Android 5, the device admin only detects manipulations. It is recommended to grant the device owner permission using adb.
Only allow parents and the user itself to view its details

This allows preventing other child users to view the configuration and used times of this child user. This is not intended as security feature and it is not one - using an older version is enough to circumvent this.
Allow using %1$s. %1$s will be blocked when the option for it in the notification area was selected or the screen was turned off.
Use this option if you know this App and you want to allow it
Open TimeLimit to view and/ or change the settings
Disable manual time confirmation on this device
If the network time is not available, use the clock from this device. Use this option if this device does not have got an internet connection often.
Select this device as current device
Allow TimeLimit to see the connected network
This App was not assigned to any category. Due to that, there are no restriction settings. And the simplest solution in this case is to block the App.
This %s is part of a category which was temporarily blocked.
This %s is part of a category which is blocked at this time.
This %s is part of a category whose time limit was reached.
This %s is part of a category whose time limit was reached. There is still extra time, but the usage limit for the extra time was reached, too.
To decide if the %s is allowed, the current time is required. The network time verification is enabled and it failed.
To prevent that the time limits are used multiple times on different devices, there must be one current device at which limited Apps can be used. This device is not selected as current device now.
This %s is part of a category which has got a battery limit and this battery limit was reached. To unlock it, charge the battery.
This %s is part of a category which has got a session duration limit and this limit was reached. It will be unlocked after the break duration.
This %s is only allowed in some networks, but no connection to such network was found.
device must be the current device
Failed to open the lock screen. You can try using the home or overview button to leave this screen.
Enter your password to sign in
Set myself as current user of this device
Don\'t ask again at this device
You can only disable asking for a password on devices to which you were assigned.
You can\'t sign in as %s because there was no password configured
Signing in as child requires the premium version
You are already the current user of this device
This will set you as the current user of this device
The user of this device was changed
The current time is required to sign in with this user
The category %1$s is blocked now (%2$s) so you can not sign in with this user now
You can select a category whose rules will be applied to Apps without category.
This category is used for unassigned Apps
This category is not used for unassigned Apps
Use this category for unassigned Apps
Stop using this category for unassigned Apps

Here you can add WiFi networks. This category will be blocked if there are WiFi networks added and there is no connection to a specified network. A network is identified by an access point. In case of multiple access points/ repeaters, you have to add all of them one by one. Disabling the time limits temporarily additionally disables limitations caused by this feature.
You did not add any networks. This category is not limited to specific networks.
You added %s. This category is limited to the specified networks.
The permission to get the connected network is missing
You are not connected to any WiFi network
You are connected to a network which was not added
You are connected to a network which was not added, but you can not add more networks to this category
You are connected to a network which was added
TimeLimit manages the limits using categories. You can select multiple Apps and limits per category. This allows for example to set one limit for all games.
There was a manipulation at a device of this child. Go back to the overview and open the corresponding device entry for details.
A child with a password can set itself as the current user of a device (using the authentication screen which is opened by the lock button at the bottom right)
This child has got a password
This child does not have a password
Press back to show the overview screen of TimeLimit

This allows (depending on the App) blocking some features within an App. If you don\'t understand what Android-Activities are, don\'t enable this. You can add activities to a category by holding the App at the add category apps screen.
The default user is a user to which any user at the device can switch without a password (to sign out). This is useful at devices which can be used by multiple different users.
You can only switch to the default user at the device itself
You can only switch to the default user if a default user was configured
You can not switch to the default user if the default user is already the current user
The device will not switch automatically to the default user
The device will switch automatically to the default user when it was not used for %s
enable switching automatically to default user
configure switching automatically to default user
Automatically switch to the default user

This is the screen to manage a device. \nYou can assign a user, manage the permissions and configure the usage of the network time verification here. \nLimits are for users and not for devices. Go back to the overview to configure a user.
there was a manipulation which was stopped again
You have to select warnings to ignore first
If TimeLimit does not start fast enough after a reboot, then you can enable considering that as a manipulation. This considers EVERY device (re)boot a manipulation.
Why is this device not limited?
There is no child assigned to this device. Only children are limited.

Most likely, this devices manufacturer added some battery optimizations which were not disabled and cause trouble. You can find details for some common manufacturers at https://dontkillmyapp.com/ \nIf that does not solve your issue, get in touch with the support of TimeLimit.
This is the device which is in front of you
TimeLimit can use the Internet to prevent a manipulation by modifying the system clock. For this, a request to the TimeLimit server is sent.
Disable and use the system time
Use if possible, otherwise use the local clock
Use always, otherwise block when limited categories are used
TimeLimit uses the permission for the usage stats access. This is only used to detect the currently used App.

TimeLimit uses the notification access to block notifications of blocked apps. Notifications and their contents are not saved. Additionally, this is used to detect and block background music playback.
Enabling drawing on top of other Apps can improve blocking in some cases. Moreover, this is one way to allow TimeLimit at newer Android versions to open the lockscreen.

This is used to \"press\" the home button before showing the lock screen. This fixes blocking in some cases. Moreover, this is one way to allow TimeLimit at newer Android versions to open the lockscreen. Additionally, it makes it possible to detect and leave the split screen mode when it is used and you enable that limitation feature.
The device admin permission was not granted. TimeLimit can be stopped at any time using the system settings.

The device admin permission was granted. This must be disabled before TimeLimit can be uninstalled or stopped using the system settings. This permission can be disabled without the password of the parents.

The device admin permission with the possibility to lock the system after an manipulation was granted. This must be disabled before TimeLimit can be uninstalled or stopped using the system settings. If you have locked out yourself, consult the support.
The device owner permission was granted and prevents disabling and uninstalling TimeLimit. This permission can only be disabled by TimeLimit/ a parent which uninstalls TimeLimit.
Touch this option to open the corresponding section of the system settings
Open the screen at the other device to modify the permissions
The permission is not needed due to the old Android version
This feature is not supported by this device

This device does not allow changing this permission graphically. You can only change it from a PC using ADB. 

Enable:

%s 

Disable:

%s

This device does not allow changing this permission graphically. You can only enable it from a PC using ADB. 

%s 

You can disable it by using the uninstall feature of TimeLimit.
On this device, a newer version of TimeLimit was replaced by an older one
The name of an device must not be empty.
Using this, all time limits and blocked time areas can be disabled
The selected time is in the past
The blocked time may be increased but not decreased without a parent who signs in
Set a new password knowing the old one
This allows to set a new password without knowing the old one. Access to %s is required for this.
The password recovery is not possible because no mail address was linked.

To delete %1$s, you need the password of %1$s and the password of an other parent account. This should prevent that you lock out yourself. If you don\'t know the password of %1$s and you can\'t use the password recovery, then get in touch with the support.
You are using the connected mode and this user is the last one with a linked mail address. You must link an other user before you can delete this one.
Sign in with an other user to delete %1$s.
You are logged in as %1$s. Sign in as an other user.
Enter the password of %1$s to delete %1$s.
This is the last user who can sign in at any time. Due to that, you can not remove it.
You have to link a mail address to use this feature
This allows you to see at other devices if the device is connected/ if TimeLimit is currently running.
You can use this only in the connected mode
You can only change this setting at the device itself
Enable sending if this device is connected
A key is a barcode which allows the user to sign in by scanning it. This code must be generated by TimeLimit.
There is no key for this user
This user has got the key %s
This was no valid TimeLimit key
This key is already linked to an other user
In the local mode, no mail address can be linked
Confirm that you want to link %s to your user by entering your password
The mail address %s is already linked to an other user and can not be linked to an additional user
There was a manipulation. Due to that, this device must be unlocked by a parent.

Because some users do not realize it: \n1st: In the default settings, TimeLimit can be removed easily, even by children. \n2nd: If \"it does not work\" then this is most likely caused by power saving features. This features are often enabled even if you did not enable it actively.

Because it happens sometimes that it is configured wrongly: A rule limits the total usage duration of a category at the selected days of the week. If there is a rule from monday to friday with 3 hours, then there is a limit of total 3 hours per week from monday to friday. If there is one rule per day with 3 hours, then there is a limit of 3 hours per day.
Apps with category are removed from the previous category when they are added to a new category - use parent and child categories to \"add\" an App to multiple categories
The blocked time areas are deprecated. You can use time limit rules for parts of a day with zero minutes usage duration instead. The blocked time areas will be removed in the future.
Shows amongst other things the reamining time for the currently used App
Shows when a notification was blocked by TimeLimit
Notification for parents when a child did some manipulation
Informs about available app updates for TimeLimit
Notification for childs if there is not much time remaining
Notification if the premium version expires shortly
TimeLimit could not block a notification
The premium version will expire soon
You are using TimeLimit at a obsolete Android version. Although this can work, it is not recommend.
You have set up TimeLimit in the local mode. There is no linking, therefore you can not add devices.

This is the overview. Here you can see devices and users (maybe you have to scroll first). 

Under devices, you can see the status of a device and assign a user. 

Under users, you can configure the allowed Apps and time limits.
There was a manipulation on this device
A required permission was not granted on this device
TimeLimit was uninstalled at this device
Asking for password was disabled at this device
You could setup timelimit manually now. However, here you can do it more easily.

Here you can select a category. As soon as Apps of this category are blocked, you can not sign in with your parent user. This can be used to prevent you from disabling limits which you set for yourself while they are active.
You can sign in at any time
You can not sign in when %1$s is blocked for %2$s
You must create another parent user as backup (in case you lock out yourself) before you can use this feature
You must be signed in as the user to select a category. Other users can only disable this feature.
You have chosen the parent key mode. This allows you to use your device as parent key. In case this is not what you want, reset/ reinstall TimeLimit.
The password must have at least %d characters
The password must have at least %d letters

The current device is the device on which limited Apps can be used if a child has got multiple devices. This prevents that a child uses the time limit multiple times if no synchronization between the devices is possible. There can only be one current device per child.
You are using the local mode. Due to that, there is no need to select a current device.
There is no current device selected
This device is the current device
Set this device as current device
Unset this device as current device
Allow using limited Apps at devices which are not the current device
If you like TimeLimit and want to pay for it, then you can buy a stay awesome license here. This does not unlock additional features.

The purchase is assigned to your family and is valid on all devices. The family are all devices which are linked to this device now and in the future. For apps and in-app products offered through Google Play, the transaction fee is equivalent to 30% of the price.
For apps and in-app products offered through Google Play, the transaction fee is equivalent to 30% of the price.
The payment via Google Play is not supported by your device
This build does not support payments. Get in touch with the support for purchases.
You paid already. You can only extend the premium version if it expired or shortly before that.
The server does not accept payments currently
The server does support payments, but not using this app build
Press back to go back to the App
The feature requires the premium version. You can find the option to buy it at the App start screen in the tab \"About\".
This feature is only available in the premium version.
This feature is only available in the premium version and the local mode.
This feature is only available in the local mode.

You can use the premium version temporarily. After that, the features of the premium version are disabled and you can only use the features of the free version or you buy the premium version to continue using the features of it.
This device was removed from TimeLimit
Do you want to remove %s? TimeLimit will be disabled at this device.
You can not remove devices in the local mode
You can chose to hide some messages. This allows to show these messages again.
You did not hide any hints
The authentication was successfully. You can set a new password now.
You did not sign in with the mail address which was linked. Due to that, the password can not be reset using this function. Ask the support to find a solution.
The App Binary Eye is required to scan a barcode

TimeLimit needs some permissions to work. Only the usage stats access permission is absolutely necessary. Starting Android 10, the permission \"Draw over other Apps\" or \"Accessibility service\" is required to open the lockscreen. The other permissions are required for some extra features.
A parent must authenticate to finish the setup
You can configure this more in detail later
To which category should these Apps be added?
Keep your eye open for this icon:
You can show some additional info about something when ever you see it by touching it like in the upper right of the following example

Some questions are answered at https://timelimit.io/en/ and it is a good idea to take a look at https://timelimit.io/en/configsuggestions/ because the default configuration is most likely not what you need. This links are shown in the about screen, so there is no need to write them down. If all that does not help you, then you can still ask the support.
Select a password which allows you to change the settings. You can add more parents and passwords later.
Add a new device to an existing family
The name is used to allow you to recognize the different users in the family.

The password is requested when you change the settings of TimeLimit. You can change your password at any time if you have got access to %s. You can add one user per parent (each with an own password).
Every device gets an name to allow you to recognize it later.
It is currently not possible to create new accounts

For the connected mode, there is a central unit - the server. This server saves the settings, the usage durations and the status of the devices (granted permissions, installed Apps, App and OS version).
Because you have not selected anything different, you are using the default server which is provided by the developer of the App. The privacy policy applies.
You have selected a server. The privacy policy of the provider of this server applies.
You can prevent the data transmission by using the local mode.
Start adding a device to another device on which TimeLimit is installed already by selecting \"Add device\" in the overview of TimeLimit at the other device. Enter here the code which is shown there.
TimeLimit limits this device. There is no connection to other devices.
TimeLimit does not limit this device. It is used to configure TimeLimit on other devices. You have to sign in using an e-mail address.
connected device of a child or another parent
This device is linked to another one. All settings for TimeLimit can be changed from any linked device. You sign in by a code which was generated on another device on which TimeLimit is installed.

TimeLimit will not limit this device. This device will be one possible key to unlock the settings of TimeLimit at an other device which uses the local mode (there is always a password to unlock the settings).
Not a setup option. TimeLimit revokes all permissions which prevent an uninstallation (if any) and starts the deletion of itself.

To use TimeLimit with the default server you have to accept the terms of use and privacy. You can find the current versions at https://legal.timelimit.io/en/terms/ and https://legal.timelimit.io/en/privacy/

You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along with this program. If not, see https://www.gnu.org/licenses/.
Apps from Google Play must be uninstallable by the user. Due to that, TimeLimit can be uninstalled without a password. Moreover, it is better if the child accepts the time limits voluntarily.
All settings of TimeLimit are deleted from this device. After this, you can reconfigure TimeLimit or uninstall it.
I am sure that I want to remove TimeLimit from this device
The user is signed in at the device %s. Please ensure that there is a connection to the other device and that the other device is on.
This action requires the premium version
This build does not have an integrated updater. Check the place where you downloaded TimeLimit to get updates.
There is currently no update available
TimeLimit needs your permission to update itself
TimeLimit can automatically check for updates. For this, it queries %s.
There seems to be a new version now
TimeLimit needs your permission to install updates
The update failed; The system reported the error %s
The usage is only saved when there are time limits and the limited Apps are used
Session duration limit of %s with %s break
TimeLimit needs this permission to work correctly. Select \"permissions\" below to enable it.
Draw over other Apps or Accessibility service is required
If this device is assigned to a child and this child has got categories, then the categories should appear here.
This allows TimeLimit to detect if it was stopped.
This allows TimeLimit to prevent it from being disabled.
Do you want to disable the device admin?
